contextId.information: The writer uses this question to emphasize his point that the next king will not be able to do anything more valuable that what he had already done. AT: "For the next king can do nothing ... which has not already been done." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: For what can the next king do ... which has not already been done?

contextId.information: The writer uses this question to emphasize his point that there is no benefit to being wise. AT: "So it makes no difference if I am very wise." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: So what difference does it make if I am very wise?

contextId.information: AT: "For no one knows whether he will be a wise man or a fool." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: For who knows whether he will be a wise man or a fool?

contextId.information: AT: "For the person who works so hard and tries in his heart to complete his labors under the sun gains nothing." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: For what profit does the person gain who works so hard and tries in his heart to complete his labors under the sun?
is not everything just a breath?

contextId.information: The writer is making a claim that animals do have a spirit. AT: "No one knows whether the spirit ... into the earth." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Who knows whether the spirit ... into the earth?

contextId.information: No one has raised any person or animal from the dead. AT: "No one can bring ... after him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

The writer uses this question to emphasize his point that there is no benefit in working for the wind. AT: "No one gets any profit in working for the wind." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: So what profit does anyone get in working for the wind?

contextId.information: A wise person's wisdom does not entitle him to any additional comforts. AT: "the wise person has no advantage over the fool." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: what advantage has the wise person over the fool?

contextId.information: AT: "You should not be doing what you are doing." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
The writer asks this question to emphasize that no one know what will happen in the future. AT: "No one knows what is coming after him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Who knows what is coming after him?
